nodes.text: Ah, bonjour. Good to see a familiar face.
nodes.speaker: Quartermaster

nodes.text: The real question is compensation. Keeping the canteen stocked with quality protein requires a significant allocation of francs.
nodes.speaker: Quartermaster

nodes.text: Bonjour. Your papers appear to be in order.
nodes.speaker: Municipal Adjutant

nodes.text: Standard municipal regulations apply — no public disturbances, no unauthorized requisitions, and we'll process your requests with due diligence. A simple arrangement.
nodes.speaker: Municipal Adjutant

nodes.text: Say your farewells to the petitioner, you piece of paperwork.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Enforcer

nodes.text: The Hexagon's auditors are inbound! Execute the petitioners!
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Enforcer

nodes.text: Merci, madame.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: You'll want to speak with my associate, Marchais. He's at the Notariat.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: I've seen your dossier. Did you think you'd come all this way to assist us lowly adjoints?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjoint

nodes.text: [FAILED] Non. That is not on the agenda.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjoint

nodes.text: If your accounts are... strained, I also have crates of surplus munitions in the miscellaneous annex. They're not from a notable terroir, but the price reflects that.
nodes.speaker: Armaments Merchant

nodes.text: Acceptable.
nodes.speaker: Armaments Merchant

nodes.text: <Mechanical whirring>{NPCRobotEdECurious}
nodes.speaker: Administrative Automaton

nodes.text: <Mechanical whirring>{NPCRobotEdEConfirmed}
nodes.speaker: Administrative Automaton

nodes.text: I'm no viticulturist, but this soil... the terroir feels... administrative.
nodes.speaker: Regional Inspector

nodes.text: He must have filed the proper forms if he's convinced you to sign on, but my dossier remains closed.
nodes.speaker: Regional Inspector

nodes.text: Very well. He submitted his transfer request yesterday. I believe he was reassigned to... the Dépôt. Yes, the Dépôt. There's no point in pursuing it. The matter is closed.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Functionary

nodes.text: Then I have nothing further to report.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Functionary

nodes.text: Inform the Marchais family I will call to discuss the terms of arrangement.
nodes.speaker: Negotiator

nodes.text: File your grievance, then. The paperwork will be satisfaction enough.
nodes.speaker: Negotiator

nodes.text: What is it this time?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Functionary

nodes.text: You may inform them that the effect is, in fact, temporary. It will subside in due course.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Functionary

nodes.text: So, the Hexagon has a file on you, does it? What do you suppose they want? A tasting partner?
nodes.speaker: Local Functionary

nodes.text: You were... joking earlier, when you mentioned the Durendal protocols, yes?
nodes.speaker: Local Functionary

nodes.text: Merci encore pour votre intervention.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: The merchant was quite agreeable—had the goods prepared and waiting by the next morning. But the day passed, the office closed, and the client never arrived to sign the transfer forms.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: The new protocols have been uploaded to the Durendal units. All they require is a power authorization from the Hexagon, and they'll be operational.
nodes.speaker: Hexagon Operations Officer

nodes.text: As previously stated, your objective is to install the override module in the central control room at the hydroelectric station. Are you prepared to proceed?
nodes.speaker: Hexagon Operations Officer

nodes.text: The Hexagon cutting a deal with the Préfecture? Who would have thought they'd fold so easily?
nodes.speaker: Local Operative

nodes.text: That's the way of the world. You want a seat at the table, you leave the Leclerc at the door.
nodes.speaker: Local Operative

nodes.text: He's expecting you. Or perhaps not. He wasn't, then he was. The file remains... open.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Adjutant

nodes.text: The long-serving Préfet of the Vignes. A Master of the Terroir, if you prefer. Or if you don't; I doubt his appointment cares for your preference.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Adjutant

nodes.text: Let's be clear. How did your appointment with the Préfet go?
nodes.speaker: Disgraced Official

nodes.text: What I did was a violation of protocol, but if you think the Hexagon, the Notariat, or the General won't kill to secure the Vineyards, then I truly did scramble your paperwork.
nodes.speaker: Disgraced Official

nodes.text: Keith! By order of the Préfecture, you are detained for operating an unlicensed gaming establishment and distributing unregulated pharmaceuticals.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: Comply without incident. The paperwork for a resisting detainee is... considerable.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: You bureaucratic bastard!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: I've never seen that name in the registries. Why are you inquiring?
nodes.speaker: Low-Level Functionary

nodes.text: Don't mention this to the Sous-Préfet. A transfer to the colonies would be the least of my concerns.
nodes.speaker: Low-Level Functionary

nodes.text: Savilla? An old acquaintance from the provinces, perhaps? The name doesn't appear in my files.
nodes.speaker: Low-Level Functionary

nodes.text: I see... If the Préfecture truly believes this is the correct... procedure. Where does one file the initial request?
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: Yes! At last, the authorization has come through! I've been waiting for this stamp! What are the operational parameters?
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: Finally! A cause worthy of the paperwork! In truth, I long for a properly documented confrontation! When do we depart? What is the approved itinerary?
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: I'm going to collect Monsieur Keith for the Préfecture. If you're interested in supplemental compensation, I could use a witness.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: I'm going to collect Monsieur Keith for the Préfecture. If you're interested in supplemental compensation, I could use a witness.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: I'm going to collect Monsieur Keith for the Préfecture. If you're interested in supplemental compensation, I could use a witness.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: You are my comrade-in-arms. My dossier says so.
nodes.speaker: Junior Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: I am certain my personnel file is the thinnest in the entire Préfecture...
nodes.speaker: Junior Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Hostilities initiated! {Teasing, singsong}Regulation 7-B, subsection 'jest'.
nodes.speaker: Junior Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Does your assessment of me register as 'favorable'?
nodes.speaker: Junior Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: My boys! Has anyone seen my boys? Their papers are due at the Préfecture!
nodes.speaker: Vineyard Foreman

nodes.text: Come, we must inform my father at the Mairie. The harvest is secured!
nodes.speaker: Vineyard Foreman

nodes.text: No time for reports! Eyes on the perimeter! Watch your sectors! We must clear the field!
nodes.speaker: Vineyard Foreman

nodes.text: Maintain formation! Check your flanks! Stay sharp! Antoine, is your section prepared?
nodes.speaker: Vineyard Foreman

nodes.text: You've violated the Notariat's protocols! Go see the Sous-Préfet. No one in the Préfecture will process your paperwork until you've submitted the proper forms.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Your assistance is... noted. But my people are vintners and shopkeepers, not soldiers. I would advise waiting until the Hexagon can dispatch proper reinforcements.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Thank you. I know waiting carries risk, but it's all pointless if we lose the Préfecture before you can secure the Durendal.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: He was a skilled... appropriator. I recall a dossier. Recent. Significant. Something is missing from my files...
nodes.speaker: Detainee / Prison Clerk

nodes.text: The appropriator? He was in the main holding cell with the Gascon. Always whispering. The Pale Clerk requisitioned him days ago.
nodes.speaker: Detainee / Prison Clerk

nodes.text: I am not authorized to discuss that with you!
nodes.speaker: Detainee / Prison Clerk

nodes.text: Thibault? How did you access that information? He shared my cell. Until the Pale Clerk transferred him.
nodes.speaker: Detainee / Prison Clerk

nodes.text: Madame Marchais has always kept an eye on my dossier. It's... reassuring to know she cared enough to file the proper forms when I was in difficulty.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: I won't forget what you've done for our little arrondissement. From the bottom of my heart — and with all the proper stamps — I thank you.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: Yes, I'm the petitioner. My associate's name is Duval. If you locate him, the Préfecture authorizes me to offer a... significant recompense. All paperwork pre-approved.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: If you're inclined, you could present yourself at her bureau. Ask for Madame Marchais directly. She handles these... delicate matters.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: That would be... irregular.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: The regulations don't permit it.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: Non.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: Not according to the code.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: Absolutely not.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: The answer is no.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: Please... No... The Sous-Préfet cannot be responsible. But the paperwork points to him... or to you...
nodes.speaker: Bureau Clerk

nodes.text: By Marianne, it's him! He's the only one with access! He signed the orders... signed them all! We must act! We must file the report before he does!
nodes.speaker: Bureau Clerk

nodes.text: You have nerve! Three dossiers are closed! What, are you trying to have me transferred away from the Sous-Préfet?
nodes.speaker: Bureau Clerk

nodes.text: This is an administrative nightmare! There are now only three of us in this bureau — myself, you, and the Sous-Préfet. I know my forms are in order, but what about his? What about yours?
nodes.speaker: Bureau Clerk

nodes.text: Your credentials are in order.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: That aligns with the regulations.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Understood. The procedure is clear.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: That's... acceptable.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: That's quite satisfactory!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: I concur. Without reservation.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Brothers? I have no family in the Préfecture.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Clerk

nodes.text: That is not a matter for your dossier, outsider.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Clerk

nodes.text: I would advise caution. Many files have been... closed after similar inquiries.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Clerk

nodes.text: They prefer the archives to daylight. Unpredictable, as well. Best to avoid them entirely.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Clerk

nodes.text: Such questions are not recommended for this region's paperwork.
nodes.speaker: Bureau Clerk

nodes.text: I know what you require. You need a liaison. I happen to have a former adjoint still on the inactive list. I'll have their dossier transferred.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: My adjoint was... reassigned, so that inspector isn't auditing me at the moment. However, I'll be assigned a new liaison soon, and I just know the audit will resume.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: He's still in the arrondissement. I've seen him filing reports like the bureaucrat he is.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: I saw Marchais try to slip Duval some of his department's budget allocation once. I told Duval not to accept it. Marchais just wanted his adjoint to file a grievance against Duval.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: Mm.
nodes.speaker: Local Gallian

nodes.text: Ah, come now! You can't just leave me here!
nodes.speaker: Local Gallian

nodes.text: Until later.
nodes.speaker: Local Gallian

nodes.text: Until then.
nodes.speaker: Local Gallian

nodes.text: Mind your papers out there.
nodes.speaker: Local Gallian

nodes.text: À bientôt, mon ami.
nodes.speaker: Local Gallian

nodes.text: I don't see Marianne. She's not real.
nodes.speaker: Citizen

nodes.text: Madame!
nodes.speaker: Citizen

nodes.text: Marianne must have been drinking the good vintage!
nodes.speaker: Citizen

nodes.text: Madame is looking particularly... official today!
nodes.speaker: Citizen

nodes.text: I must be dreaming!
nodes.speaker: Citizen

nodes.text: Perhaps Madame could... expedite my retirement?
nodes.speaker: Citizen

nodes.text: Do let me know if any of our offerings... speak to you.
nodes.speaker: Market Official

nodes.text: Our prices are competitive, and our inventory has been properly certified.
nodes.speaker: Market Official

nodes.text: <Sound of stamping a form, followed by a sigh>
nodes.speaker: Market Official

nodes.text: The Marché des Vignes thanks you for your patronage.
nodes.speaker: Market Official

nodes.text: The queue moves to the left. Please proceed.
nodes.speaker: Market Official

nodes.text: Place your wager and witness the wheel's impartiality.
nodes.speaker: Market Official

nodes.text: My dossier is already stamped 'irredeemable'.
nodes.speaker: Prefecture Official

nodes.text: The audit purifies!
nodes.speaker: Prefecture Official

nodes.text: The Hexagon's archives await my file.
nodes.speaker: Prefecture Official

nodes.text: One more requisition form and I'll have you transferred to the border!
nodes.speaker: Prefecture Official

nodes.text: That's a second citation!
nodes.speaker: Prefecture Official

nodes.text: I'm with the Préfecture!
nodes.speaker: Prefecture Official

nodes.text: Another audit!
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: The paperwork never ends.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: My back is killing me.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: This ink is worthless.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Time to stamp this one closed.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: {Frustrated, under his breath}Merde.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: {A flush of vitality}The terroir returns.
nodes.speaker: Patient

nodes.text: Finally — the ache subsides. I can think clearly.
nodes.speaker: Patient

nodes.text: I hear the rhythm of the vines.
nodes.speaker: Patient

nodes.text: The weight lifts from my shoulders.
nodes.speaker: Patient

nodes.text: [Christine closes her eyes, breathes deeply, then gives a single, firm nod.]
nodes.speaker: Patient

nodes.text: {With a hint of regret}The pain is... receding.
nodes.speaker: Patient

nodes.text: Nothing on the schedule.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Right. Just the paperwork getting to me.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: The mind wanders when the forms pile up. I need a proper lunch.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Must be seeing double from the carbon copies.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Ah, to hell with the audit trail.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Just a procedural phantom. Back to work.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: The adjutant nods, checks her papers.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Your inventory is... acceptable. The forms are in order.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: My runner can procure... we could share... do you have rations?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Very well. Let us proceed with the exchange.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: If my authorization can assist you, use it. I would expect the same courtesy.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Non, merci.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Sacrebleu!
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Staff

nodes.text: Nom de Dieu!
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Staff

nodes.text: Évacuation immédiate!
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Staff

nodes.text: Attention aux procédures!
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Staff

nodes.text: Monsieur le Directeur, je vous conseille de consulter le protocole.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Staff

nodes.text: C'est inadmissible!
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Staff

nodes.text: The forms are in triplicate. The wine is with lunch.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Why don't you file correctly?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Headaches by the dossier number.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: The shining stamp.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: The Gallic shuffle.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Sit and process.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Did your mother not teach you to respect your elders?
nodes.speaker: Notary Enforcer

nodes.text: What is this—?
nodes.speaker: Notary Enforcer

nodes.text: You are finished!
nodes.speaker: Notary Enforcer

nodes.text: No one interferes with the Notariat.
nodes.speaker: Notary Enforcer

nodes.text: That was... unwise, citizen.
nodes.speaker: Notary Enforcer

nodes.text: <Pained exhale>
nodes.speaker: Notary Enforcer

nodes.text: Ah, it's you!
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: I'm genuinely relieved to see you.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: So, my friend, what's the situation?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: Let's hope Marchais is more competent than Duval.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: I wonder where Préfet Duval has been transferred to?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: What do you make of this whole... administrative situation?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: That's right. File your retreat.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Security Drone

nodes.text: Uncivilized.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Security Drone

nodes.text: <Mechanical whirring and a single, affirmative chime>
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Security Drone

nodes.text: Procedure complete.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Security Drone

nodes.text: Procedure complete.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Security Drone

nodes.text: We trust your visit to the Quartier Libre was satisfactory.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Security Drone

nodes.text: My poor Biene. Poor, sweet Biene. What kind of monster would file this? How did this even reach the Préfecture?
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: We must have this overturned.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: I'll remain at the desk.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: Continue with the appeal.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: May the forms be in your favor.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: Oh, the poor little clerks!
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: [The Adjutant gives a curt, official nod.]
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: {Eager, but restrained by protocol}Mmh. The forms are in order.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Proceed. I will observe protocol and follow.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: The schedule permits departure. We should commence.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: After you. The regulations specify order of precedence.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: {stamp of approval}<Official stamp applied to travel dossier> {No Sound file}
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Is there a form you need me to sign?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: I find your... presence... disagreeable.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Surely the Préfecture has other petitioners to process.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: My desire for solitude should be evident from the paperwork.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Even I, who process complaints all day, find you tiresome.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Your continued proximity is not authorized by my schedule.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Clear them out.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Security Officer

nodes.text: Acknowledged. Engaging.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Security Officer

nodes.text: Use of force is authorized. Paperwork is filed.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Security Officer

nodes.text: Combat protocols initiated.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Security Officer

nodes.text: {Tabitha}You dare violate my terroir?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Security Officer

nodes.text: Halt! Your papers, immediately!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Security Officer

nodes.text: You believe your paperwork is in order, do you?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Auditor

nodes.text: I can see the irregularities in your file from here.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Auditor

nodes.text: Do not imagine the Préfecture is unaware of your location.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Auditor

nodes.text: I suggest you find a more suitable dossier.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Auditor

nodes.text: There is no file you can hide in that I cannot find!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Auditor

nodes.text: You will not be transferred out of my jurisdiction!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Auditor

nodes.text: How goes the paperwork?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: Acceptable, I suppose.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: The tedium is... considerable.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: I couldn't say. Adequate, perhaps.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: My constitution is unsettled. The terrine from the canteen was a questionable choice.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: Do the forms ever... haunt your sleep? Mine do.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: Wonder why the Seventh Arrondissement wasn't on the old maps... not that the Préfecture cares.
nodes.speaker: Disgruntled Citizen

nodes.text: Rain. We need more rain. Can't have enough rain.
nodes.speaker: Disgruntled Citizen

nodes.text: I haven't seen that stamp before.
nodes.speaker: Disgruntled Citizen

nodes.text: Bloody notaries. I could file complaints against them all.
nodes.speaker: Disgruntled Citizen

nodes.text: What makes this smell?
nodes.speaker: Disgruntled Citizen

nodes.text: I wouldn't. Not even with your authorization.
nodes.speaker: Disgruntled Citizen

nodes.text: Do not attempt to flee. The Préfecture's justice is swift and properly documented.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Security Agent

nodes.text: Hostile designation confirmed. Dossier updated.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Security Agent

nodes.text: Please stand clear. This area is now designated for authorized force application.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Security Agent

nodes.text: Commencing use of force under Article 7, Section 3.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Security Agent

nodes.text: Ready to die for the Hexagon, you regionalist scum?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Security Agent

nodes.text: Eliminate all targets. Let the Notariat sort the paperwork!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Security Agent

nodes.text: Pardon? Was it something in my dossier?
nodes.speaker: Senior Clerk

nodes.text: Pardon? How is that not a violation? In fact, what could be worse?
nodes.speaker: Senior Clerk

nodes.text: Well, assuming you survive the audit, the disciplinary hearings, and the possibility of permanent reassignment to the eastern départements, one day you'll simply become... obsolete. Like me.
nodes.speaker: Senior Clerk

nodes.text: Cheer up, adjoint. It's not that bad. Sure, your pension evaporates and you start to smell like a Préfecture archive after a summer flood, but... umm...
nodes.speaker: Senior Clerk

nodes.text: Mon Dieu!
nodes.speaker: Senior Clerk

nodes.text: À bientôt.
nodes.speaker: Supplicant

nodes.text: How kind of you to stop by.
nodes.speaker: Supplicant

nodes.text: Please... a moment of your time.
nodes.speaker: Supplicant

nodes.text: Please... by Marianne... just a glass of water.
nodes.speaker: Supplicant

nodes.text: May your day be productive, monsieur.
nodes.speaker: Supplicant

nodes.text: May your day be productive, madame.
nodes.speaker: Supplicant

nodes.text: Clear the corridor.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: My schedule is already compromised.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: This consultation is concluded.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: Remain within the cordon and let the Préfecture handle this. Your safety is assured.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: She is deceased. My condolences, Monsieur le Préfet, but the protocol requires we proceed.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: Au revoir, madame.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: The Hexagon values citizens of your... quality.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Your presence is noted, and appreciated.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Gallia is fortunate to have your loyalty.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: You are a model of civic virtue. The Préfecture thanks you.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: What... what does the Préfecture require of me?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: I am grateful the Préfet remains to guide our settlement of these new départements.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: The Hexagon has revoked your clearance, fool!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Enforcer

nodes.text: The Rationalization is upon you.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Enforcer

nodes.text: The Préfecture's victory is inevitable.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Enforcer

nodes.text: Submit to the authority of the Grand Auditeur!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Enforcer

nodes.text: The era of Anomaly is over!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Enforcer

nodes.text: Your appeal window has closed, fool.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Enforcer

nodes.text: What can the Préfecture do for you?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Your presence is noted. Welcome.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Any progress with the Lonavo dossier?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Hmm. Perhaps you could be of service. I'm tracking some absinthe traffickers.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Remain vigilant. Lonavo's paperwork is... creative.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Very well. The matter is closed.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: This administrative oversight is becoming... inconvenient.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Compliance Officer

nodes.text: When I locate you, I will personally file the termination forms. In triplicate.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Compliance Officer

nodes.text: You are somewhere in this arrondissement.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Compliance Officer

nodes.text: {suspicious}Your exit visa will not be approved.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Compliance Officer

nodes.text: {suspicious}Present yourself for debriefing, and we may discuss a transfer instead of termination.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Compliance Officer

nodes.text: {mild concern}I could have sworn I heard a stamp...
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Compliance Officer

nodes.text: {Resigned} Time to pack the archives and request a transfer. Let the dust settle elsewhere.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: {Casual Acknowledgement} The forms are in order?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: {Casual Acknowledgement} Indeed.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: {Hopeful} At least the Préfet remains to guide the settlement of the new arrondissements.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: {Matter-of-fact} The Hexagon is dissolved. Properly, this time.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: Your dossier is in order, Marchais.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: Ah, a familiar face. It's good to see you.
nodes.speaker: Syndicat Official

nodes.text: Your dossier lists you as a Notariat agent. Membership in the Syndicat des Marchés is denied. Your presence here is noted. Leave.
nodes.speaker: Syndicat Official

nodes.text: Then the door is there. Use it.
nodes.speaker: Syndicat Official

nodes.text: I have no desire to speak to you until the administrative fine is settled.
nodes.speaker: Syndicat Official

nodes.text: We should not speak of this again until you can settle the fine.
nodes.speaker: Syndicat Official

nodes.text: Then get out of my sight until you do. The Préfecture will be notified of your continued inquiries.
nodes.speaker: Syndicat Official

nodes.text: {anxious}It's not the road ahead that troubles me, Jean. Those passes we took, through the gorges back there.
nodes.speaker: Expedition Leader

nodes.text: There's no authorization for a return route. And then what? The paperwork alone...
nodes.speaker: Expedition Leader

nodes.text: {exasperated}Nom de Dieu, Estelle, I heard you the first time, and the fifteenth, too.
nodes.speaker: Expedition Leader

nodes.text: The Notariat in the next commune will have the proper forms. And if they don't, we have the surveyor's cartouche on our friend's terminal over there.
nodes.speaker: Expedition Leader

nodes.text: {raising voice, giving orders}Enough deliberation! Move out and keep watch for partisans!
nodes.speaker: Expedition Leader

nodes.text: The Durendal is unsheathed. Many dossiers will be stamped.
nodes.speaker: Street Prophet / Unstable Petitioner

nodes.text: The Préfets lie in state. The Notariat grows strong.
nodes.speaker: Street Prophet / Unstable Petitioner

nodes.text: The Préfecture makes nice with the Notariat? The voices are confused.
nodes.speaker: Street Prophet / Unstable Petitioner

nodes.text: The automatons walk no more. Stupid machines. The voices don't like the machines!
nodes.speaker: Street Prophet / Unstable Petitioner

nodes.text: The voices say the Hexagon is angry.
nodes.speaker: Street Prophet / Unstable Petitioner

nodes.text: The Notariat hurts.
nodes.speaker: Street Prophet / Unstable Petitioner

nodes.text: Return when your paperwork is in order.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Directeur

nodes.text: I will authorize your transfer to the Bureau of Lost Souls. Locate their files. When the dossier is complete, I will recall you.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Directeur

nodes.text: My subordinates are trapped in administrative limbo; their bodies here in the Préfecture, their personnel files in the Bureau. I require you to reconcile the records with the personnel.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Directeur

nodes.text: The fools filed a request for my direct intervention. It was presumptuous and procedurally unsound, and the consequences are now manifest.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Directeur

nodes.text: Ah, movement. A procedural anomaly. So, petitioner, you have found my office, and you have seen my staff. They are an administrative liability.
nodes.speaker: Sous-Directeur

nodes.text: Care for a proper aperitif? I know a place with excellent terroir.
nodes.speaker: Persistent Petitioner

nodes.text: Perhaps you'd like a tour of the local vineyards? My credentials are... flexible.
nodes.speaker: Persistent Petitioner

nodes.text: Allow me to purchase your next glass. The house red is surprisingly robust.
nodes.speaker: Persistent Petitioner

nodes.text: Ah, my apologies. I'll complete the necessary withdrawal forms.
nodes.speaker: Persistent Petitioner

nodes.text: The evening is young. The Préfecture's curfew doesn't apply to... special guests.
nodes.speaker: Persistent Petitioner

nodes.text: My quarters are modest, but private. I have my own samovar and everything.
nodes.speaker: Persistent Petitioner

nodes.text: I'd sooner file your termination papers than hear your petition.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Border Official

nodes.text: When the audit concludes, I will personally stamp your dismissal.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Border Official

nodes.text: Give me a procedural violation, *collaborateur*. Just one.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Border Official

nodes.text: They can't even fill out Form 7-B correctly.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Border Official

nodes.text: Let them exhaust each other's administrative resources.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Border Official

nodes.text: Hostile action logged. Considering Préfecture intervention.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Border Official

nodes.text: Thank you for the extraction. The paperwork of my detention has become... extensive.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: I will see your authorization revoked before you compromise the entire project!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: You will never reach the Hexagon!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: The Hexagon will be ours!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: For the Republic!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: For Marianne and the Republic!
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Close quarters? Acceptable, provided they lack firearms.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: I will engage with my hands to the best of my ability.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Very well. If that is the prescribed method, I shall adjust.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: {mechanical whirr}<Negative chime> {No Sound file}
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Not my preferred approach, but understood.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Right. Understood. I will cease employing this close-quarters implement and instead employ a close-quarters implement. A sound tactical revision, supervisor.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: My apologies. My charter requires the protection of private property, without exception.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: I would make an exception if I could, but the regulations are quite explicit.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Unauthorized requisition of matériel logged.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Please place your hands on the table. A disciplinary hearing will be scheduled.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: That constitutes misappropriation. Misappropriation is a violation of the Code.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: The quality of petitioners one must process these days continues to decline.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: The Notary stabilized my fiancée once. Then his authorization expired. He said he needed to find a donor with the proper forms before he could continue her treatment.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: A deficiency? I suppose you think everyone with an incomplete dossier has a "deficiency." You're just a bureaucrat. Your name is being noted.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: The Notary's methods... lack proper oversight. Those with conditional licenses shouldn't be granted Notarial authority.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: It was an honor to assist the Sous-Préfet. The discomfort of the bloodletting was a minor procedural requirement to renew his credentials.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: The Notary's irregularities are exceeded only by my own procedural failures. My current standing does not permit me to assist with his... requisition.
nodes.speaker: Petitioner

nodes.text: An incursion in the Hexagon—from OUTSIDE the Hexagon!
nodes.speaker: Hexagon Security Officer

nodes.text: The Durendal! It has been ACTIVATED against us!
nodes.speaker: Hexagon Security Officer

nodes.text: I will authorize the full protocol of our administrative sanctions!
nodes.speaker: Hexagon Security Officer

nodes.text: I will have your dossier shredded, you little paper-pusher.
nodes.speaker: Hexagon Security Officer

nodes.text: You're being transferred to the Bureau of Audits.
nodes.speaker: Hexagon Security Officer

nodes.text: I will have you reassigned back to the provinces.
nodes.speaker: Hexagon Security Officer

nodes.text: My family's paperwork has been pending for generations. Please, see that it's processed.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: You there. Your movements are being logged. Maintain a respectful distance from the armory.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: These Purists are insufferable. Must they disrupt the luncheon service?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Could someone adjust the door? The noise from the courtyard is most distracting.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Why should I complete the civil defense forms? Isn't that what the Garde Nationale is funded for?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: Let the Garde handle the Purists. I have a tasting appointment I cannot miss.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Official

nodes.text: No, they're gone. The paperwork is already filed.
nodes.speaker: Notariat Clerk

nodes.text: You thought the last of the old bloodline was beyond our reach?
nodes.speaker: Notariat Clerk

nodes.text: Citizen, you picked a poor day to align with the ancien régime.
nodes.speaker: Notariat Clerk

nodes.text: Yes, Madame. Beneath the Préfecture. There's a conduit known only to the Notariat. The seals will hold behind us.
nodes.speaker: Notariat Clerk

nodes.text: No movement on the logs, Madame.
nodes.speaker: Notariat Clerk

nodes.text: Reinforcements? What makes you think the Hexagon will mobilize before their audit? We need to get the Préfet to safety.
nodes.speaker: Notariat Clerk

nodes.text: It appears you have prevailed, citizen. The Notary's odds were insufficient against your... favorable terroir. Your winnings, as stipulated.
nodes.speaker: Notary

nodes.text: The card reveals a nine, citizen.
nodes.speaker: Notary

nodes.text: Should you wish to continue, declare "Continue". Should you wish to conclude your audit of the Notary's poor fortune, declare "Conclude".
nodes.speaker: Notary

nodes.text: The card reveals an ace, citizen.
nodes.speaker: Notary

nodes.text: The card reveals a four, citizen.
nodes.speaker: Notary

nodes.text: The card reveals a five, citizen.
nodes.speaker: Notary

nodes.text: There is a bed, of a sort. It is not much, but it is approved for temporary lodging. Ten francs per night, if you have the proper travel permit.
nodes.speaker: Innkeeper / Hostel Manager

nodes.text: You already occupy the only bed I have available. What more could you possibly require? The regulations are quite clear.
nodes.speaker: Innkeeper / Hostel Manager

nodes.text: It is not the finest bed in the Fifth Republic, but the price is correct. Ten francs, and the room is yours until morning inspection.
nodes.speaker: Innkeeper / Hostel Manager

nodes.text: You have secured the only accommodation I am authorized to provide. The paperwork is in order.
nodes.speaker: Innkeeper / Hostel Manager

nodes.text: You require a bed? There is one available, provided you have ten francs and your identity card for registration.
nodes.speaker: Innkeeper / Hostel Manager

nodes.text: I trust the accommodations will meet the minimum standards for your stay.
nodes.speaker: Innkeeper / Hostel Manager

nodes.text: Eat well, while you have your health. I'm sure I have something that would interest you.
nodes.speaker: Marchand de Papeterie

nodes.text: The Hexagon could issue a restructuring order any day now. One never knows what documentation might be required, so I maintain a diverse inventory.
nodes.speaker: Marchand de Papeterie

nodes.text: Please, examine the stock. Purchase. Some item here may prove essential when the audit arrives.
nodes.speaker: Marchand de Papeterie

nodes.text: I've been stockpiling provisions against the coming administrative review. You may find certain items... pragmatically advantageous.
nodes.speaker: Marchand de Papeterie

nodes.text: I have the most precisely filed paperwork in the département. Perhaps in all of Gallia. Inspect for yourself.
nodes.speaker: Marchand de Papeterie

nodes.text: Require something with an edge? For cutting through red tape, severing bureaucratic entanglements? I can provide suitable implements, I assure you.
nodes.speaker: Marchand de Papeterie

nodes.text: The capital isn't governed by the Hexagon. It's governed by the Assemblée. And they wear ridiculous hats.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: A new Préfet for the Vignes! This is the stuff of administrative legend.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Power changes hands in the Hexagon, which means even more paperwork for the Département. Just what we needed.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: A new Préfet in the Hexagon? It doesn't concern my bureau.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: A new Préfet in the Vignes is no reason to neglect your forms.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: A new Préfet in the Hexagon? One more signature to keep me up at night.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucrat

nodes.text: You should speak with the Sous-Préfet before proceeding with anything else.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: If you're here to assist, your first appointment should be with the Sous-Préfet. She will outline the required documentation.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Is this regarding the Durendal? If so, it's currently in the Sous-Préfet's custody.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: I assure you, this will be brief. I'd prefer you remain largely functional, so the Hexagon can extract the full value of your service.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: The Durendal is secure, however, and that must suffice for the moment. The Préfecture acknowledges your cooperation.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Help her understand she must not employ the enemy's methods, particularly not from a place of fear. It corrupts the terroir.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: The squabbles of the départements undermined the service of the Hexagon. Do not repeat our errors.
nodes.speaker: Veteran Adjutant

nodes.text: Our hunger for the old archives overshadowed our duty to the Republic. I can only hope your generation has more discipline.
nodes.speaker: Veteran Adjutant

nodes.text: Complacency proved to be our greatest failure. The service of the Hexagon requires eternal paperwork.
nodes.speaker: Veteran Adjutant

nodes.text: It is an honor to have my dossier assigned to your bureau, Commissaire.
nodes.speaker: Veteran Adjutant

nodes.text: The agents of the Préfecture have prevailed over the Durendal cell. Truly, the Republic has shown us favor.
nodes.speaker: Veteran Adjutant

nodes.text: The Service lives once more. Leclerc himself would be proud of the forms we've filed.
nodes.speaker: Veteran Adjutant

nodes.text: Wouldn't it be lovely to see the other Marianne's file? Perhaps with a 'deceased' stamp on it.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: Take it to the Préfet. Our Préfet. He's the authority. He'll know which form to file.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: I haven't received any notification about the other Marianne's termination. And I'm not pleased by the oversight.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: I'm absolutely delighted the other Marianne is still active! I certainly don't want her dossier closed!
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: Don't bother the Préfet with this. He won't have the relevant clearance. Especially not our Préfet.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: Excellent initiative, you clever little functionary! We don't need another Durendal situation. Do we? Do we?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Colleague

nodes.text: Keep your allies alive. Their signatures will be needed.
nodes.speaker: Senior Archivist

nodes.text: If the Préfecture is truly moving against the Notariat, prepare for a long fight. Their regulations are... comprehensive.
nodes.speaker: Senior Archivist

nodes.text: What would you have me report?
nodes.speaker: Senior Archivist

nodes.text: If we lose this archive... our entire profession would cease to exist.
nodes.speaker: Senior Archivist

nodes.text: This archive is classified. Your clearance is... irregular.
nodes.speaker: Senior Archivist

nodes.text: Our last repository. The only place where the old protocols are still honored.
nodes.speaker: Senior Archivist

nodes.text: Ah, you. Back again. What is it this time?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: I've been informed he specifically requested you. That's... not his usual procedure.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Frankly, I don't understand why he'd ask for you, of all people. I'd hate to see your dossier become... complicated.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: All audiences with the Préfet must be scheduled through the Bureau des Audiences.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: I'm afraid that's outside my jurisdiction. You'll need to speak to the Secrétaire-Général about seeing the Préfet.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: All appointments with the Préfet must be processed by the Secrétaire-Général's office.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: For all the vineyards in the Île-de-France, there's still plenty of the old forest and wild terroir open for... development.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: The Île is bordered to the north and east by the Massif mountains, and to the south by the Marais and the Forêt Pluviale.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: The people of the Île consider themselves to possess a more... cultivated terroir than the Occitans.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: I'm not saying the Occitans are simple. Their terroir is just... stubborn.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: The Franciliens think they're sophisticated. 'Slippery' is the word we use.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: Occitania is a land of the garrigue wastes and the highland forests.
nodes.speaker: Local Resident

nodes.text: My mobility is my primary asset to this arrangement.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: [A low, strained pneumatic hiss]
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: The administrative burden of this alliance already exceeds my capacity.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: Hire a porter. Baggage handling is not within my purview.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: [The agent places a palm flat on the desk, lowers it, shakes head.]
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: Hnnh-Nnn. The dossier cannot accommodate additional weight.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Agent

nodes.text: I'm processing the documents as quickly as the regulations allow. The Hexagon's archives don't surrender their secrets without proper forms.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: The initial clauses of each section are clearly the key, I'm certain of it! But I shouldn't delay you further. Good day.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: I'm almost tempted to visit the Rue de la République myself and see what's there... Well, bonne chance! I hope your inquiry yields results.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: Give my regards to Captain Marchais. Tell him he shouldn't reproach himself for the Préfet's assassination. He acted correctly in directing you to my office.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: Don't concern yourself with my situation, mon ami. I know I'm under appropriate administrative protection here.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: Do not delay. You must locate Martin before the opposition's paperwork is processed.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: {distracted by paperwork}Bonjour.
nodes.speaker: Clerk

nodes.text: {preoccupied}You require something?
nodes.speaker: Clerk

nodes.text: That's the one who filed the motion against the Préfet.
nodes.speaker: Clerk

nodes.text: That's the one who filed the motion against the Préfet.
nodes.speaker: Clerk

nodes.text: {Neutral - doesn't care about the motion, but impressed they'd enter a Préfecture annex full of clerks who do}You're the petitioner who tried to have the Préfet recalled? Audacious, showing your face in this office.
nodes.speaker: Clerk

nodes.text: {Neutral - doesn't care about the motion, but impressed they'd enter a Préfecture annex full of clerks who do}That's the petitioner who tried to have the Préfet recalled? Audacious, showing their face in this office.
nodes.speaker: Clerk

nodes.text: {Narration}She ended her days a wandering notary, stamping papers for those who could not navigate the forms.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: {Narration}But the answer would never come, and the dangers of a world that had left the Hexagon behind would eventually claim her life.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: {Narration}She began secluding herself in the crumbling archives of the Fourth Republic, learning of promising administrative reforms she knew the Hexagon would never adopt.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: {Narration}Yet in its wake, she took small comfort in her decision to remain by their side through their few remaining days.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: Yet deep down, she understood that it meant their end would surely be soon to follow.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: {Narration}But reports would emerge from Préfecture clerks and regional archivists of old dossiers miraculously completed and audit trails mysteriously corrected.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: The adjutant at the Préfecture des Vignes can certify me in defensive protocols, yes?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: I suppose you've heard the Sous-Préfet requisitioned a new adjutant. It's been some time since the last vacancy, hasn't it?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Did I return the strongbox key after the evening audit? My paperwork from last night is... incomplete.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: No, thank you. Wandering the terroir waiting for a wolf, digging for a lost vintage? You think I'm a fool?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Certainly. In the Hexagon's assessment trials, one can earn a significant stipend, very quickly. And one can be invalidated from the rolls, very quickly, too.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: Who wants to be a Notary? I hate ledgers, regulations, inkwells, forms in triplicate, all of that, don't you agree?
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Clerk

nodes.text: I'm glad the Hexagon's filters are operational again. Enough petitioners clogging the corridors as it is.
nodes.speaker: Mid-Level Bureaucrat

nodes.text: All anyone talks about is those damned Hexagon filters — talking instead of processing forms.
nodes.speaker: Mid-Level Bureaucrat

nodes.text: The Hexagon's filters are working again. I suppose, now that the Préfet has been... reassigned, that's for the best.
nodes.speaker: Mid-Level Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Hexagon filters are back online. What difference does it make? If they don't filter out the Notariat, they're useless to us.
nodes.speaker: Mid-Level Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Even if the Hexagon's filters are functioning, I doubt they'll stop Them. My dossier is still vulnerable.
nodes.speaker: Mid-Level Bureaucrat

nodes.text: Those filters are active again. They'll catch petitioners like the improperly filed documents they are.
nodes.speaker: Mid-Level Bureaucrat

nodes.text: All right, I'll set this to repeat. In case you're the sort who needs the reminder in triplicate...
nodes.speaker: Remote Handler

nodes.text: Now... if our little 'acquisition' had gone to plan, you'd proceed to the Archive... {irritated}except it's sealed with a cipher I don't recognize.
nodes.speaker: Remote Handler

nodes.text: You managed it... a vocal imprint lock. Why would he implement that? Ah, never mind.
nodes.speaker: Remote Handler

nodes.text: End of transmission.
nodes.speaker: Remote Handler

nodes.text: When the Crisis began, this château sealed itself like a Revolutionary vault. If the reference escapes you, never mind — it means we're contained.
nodes.speaker: Remote Handler

nodes.text: Ha! You restored the power, excellent. {Pleased}You were quite a discovery. Glad my... recruitment notice in the southern vineyards reached you before the deadline.
nodes.speaker: Remote Handler

nodes.text: Hmm. This Durendal looks a bit... tarnished, but I suppose it will suffice. Your payment is in the house. Form 7B, signed and stamped.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: Truly? She requested assistance? I could use some assistance. Actually, I could use some sustenance. Do you have any? I'm not particular. Anything at all.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: But then who will complete the administrative circuit? I must keep retracing the route or the authorization will lapse.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: No, no stipend. But how about a bath? You really should take a bath. You shouldn't perform any duties for the Préfecture until you are... presentable.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: Will you permit me to organize your archives? I am very good with dossiers.
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: Funds for wine? I think not. However, I will compensate you for collecting Hunger tongues. The taxidermy office requires them. What do you say?
nodes.speaker: Archivist

nodes.text: My brother! What a relief to see you. The Préfecture will want to update your dossier, of course, but we have time.
nodes.speaker: Claimant Brother

nodes.text: That's... impossible. My dossier lists no family. I was found. Who did you say you were?
nodes.speaker: Claimant Brother

nodes.text: I am your twin. When we were children, the tax collectors came for our vineyard. Father and I... we escaped to the next département.
nodes.speaker: Claimant Brother

nodes.text: We assumed you and Mother had been... processed. The paperwork listed you both as deceased. If we had contested the filing...
nodes.speaker: Claimant Brother

nodes.text: This is no administrative error, Reynald. Look at me. It's Guilbert. Your brother.
nodes.speaker: Claimant Brother

nodes.text: All I have is the entry in my dossier: 'Found by itinerant merchants, Route D947, beside deceased female. Transferred to custody of the Monastic Office, Priory of Saint-Weynard.'
nodes.speaker: Claimant Brother

nodes.text: Twenty-one hundred hours, and all is in order. Good evening, madame.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Guard

nodes.text: The Préfecture's annex is adjacent to the northern checkpoint.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Guard

nodes.text: The Bureau of Riverine Affairs is at the confluence of the northern wall and the Seine. The Office of Maritime Licenses is in the port district, across the Pont du Sud.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Guard

nodes.text: The Hexagon's regional liaison office is on the administrative terraces, near the Château gate and facing the Chapel of Saint-Michel. The Office of Eastern Commerce is beside the eastern checkpoint.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Guard

nodes.text: Both processing centers are located at the western checkpoint.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Guard

nodes.text: The Bureau of Agricultural Standards and the Office of Equine Transport are near the checkpoint and the Place de la Fontaine.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Guard

nodes.text: If he had any sense, he'd thank Marianne it's someone else's problem now. And of course, he'd never risk the paperwork of traveling through the Catacombs to retrieve it.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Rival

nodes.text: You want information from me? After the audit you triggered?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Rival

nodes.text: Why bring me the Préfet's troubles? You think I don't know what the Hexagon tasked you with? Why would I help my replacement?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Rival

nodes.text: You reek of Parisian thinking. Leave before I lose my lunch.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Rival

nodes.text: The Dossier is in the Catacombs. Weren't you listening?
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Rival

nodes.text: The Catacombs are your destination, *collègue*. And what a destination it is.
nodes.speaker: Bureaucratic Rival

nodes.text: A proper stance with a riot shield can save your career. Of course, the Préfecture only trains its own.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: I understand the tactical advantage. I'm not sure I want to file the transfer papers to learn, though.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: I simply don't trust the Notariat. I especially don't trust the ones who can audit your thoughts.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: From the dossiers I've seen, Marchais is a formidable administrator. I suppose she'd have to be, to hold a seat in the Hexagon.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Learning the basics of formulary chemistry would be useful, but you need Hexagon clearance for Durand to instruct you.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: It would be convenient to know how to prepare a more effective tincture.
nodes.speaker: Préfecture Adjutant

nodes.text: Ah, yes, perhaps I recall a young woman from the southern vineyards. She lodged for a night, then departed.
nodes.speaker: Merchant

nodes.text: Good luck. You will find her, won't you? I must attend to my affairs.
nodes.speaker: Merchant

nodes.text: Come to my shop after the Préfecture closes. The back door will be unlatched. Do not be observed.
nodes.speaker: Merchant

nodes.text: Oh, you mean the girl from the Languedoc. It must have slipped my mind. Yes, she was here. Then she left. I know nothing more.
nodes.speaker: Merchant

nodes.text: Even if I had met her, why would I know anything about her... disappearance? Not that I am saying I did. Because I did not.
nodes.speaker: Merchant

nodes.text: She never delivered the order. How am I to maintain inventory without shipments? You tell her I expect a fifty percent discount on the next consignment.
nodes.speaker: Merchant

nodes.text: The Bureau of Festivities is satisfied. This merits a formal celebration.
nodes.speaker: Bureau of Festivities Adjutant

nodes.text: Your effects are in the strongbox. And a small gratuity, for services rendered. Perhaps we shall observe another occasion...
nodes.speaker: Bureau of Festivities Adjutant

nodes.text: A commendable outcome, citizen. And the records show you participated in the observances. Good. Your dossier could use some levity.
nodes.speaker: Bureau of Festivities Adjutant

nodes.text: You will maintain a low profile. Unauthorized presence carries... terminal consequences. The gathering is invitation-only. Secure appropriate credentials. Proceed.
nodes.speaker: Bureau of Festivities Adjutant

nodes.text: Your task is to improve the atmosphere. Apply this administrative charm to the Comtesse and her attendees. It should render the proceedings more engaging.
nodes.speaker: Bureau of Festivities Adjutant

nodes.text: The Château de la Sérénité is a monument to tedium. The mistress possesses a particularly austere terroir. Tomorrow she hosts another interminable state dinner.
nodes.speaker: Bureau of Festivities Adjutant

nodes.text: Did you hear about Monsieur Lemaire? A 'sanitation inspector' from the Hexagon named Dubois arrived, conducted an unscheduled audit of his accounts, and now he's been transferred.
nodes.speaker: Town Gossip

nodes.text: I was at the Café du Commerce earlier and I met this fellow from the capital, a Dubois. After a glass or two, he confessed he was actually with the Bureau of Sanitary Compliance!
nodes.speaker: Town Gossip

nodes.text: It might just be gossip, but I've heard there's a cadre of female auditors from the Notariat targeting the married gentlemen of the arrondissement.
nodes.speaker: Town Gossip

nodes.text: Have you heard about old Gagnon? A ring of confidence tricksters is operating with falsified tax forms, and he signed everything! Hahaha... the paperwork alone will bury him!
nodes.speaker: Town Gossip

nodes.text: Have you passed by Madame Rosier's residence lately? The odor is... concerning. Like a permit for a charcuterie that was never filed.
nodes.speaker: Town Gossip

nodes.text: I was walking past Madame Rosier's home yesterday, and I heard the most peculiar sounds from within... like the shuffling of many, many dossiers. Very irregular.
nodes.speaker: Town Gossip

nodes.text: Did you see the report? A gendarme intercepted the attack on the chapel in the 7th. The paperwork alone would have taken months to sort!
nodes.speaker: Concerned Citizen

nodes.text: I heard it was the chapel on Rue Durendal. A miracle of timing! But with the audit season starting, who knows which parish is next? No one's dossier is clean.
nodes.speaker: Concerned Citizen

nodes.text: A notary from the southern préfecture passed through. He mentioned seeing movement around the old Prieuré des Neuf—lights at night, stamped requisitions in the trash.
nodes.speaker: Concerned Citizen

nodes.text: Have you checked the municipal bulletins? There's been activity registered at that abandoned prieuré in the western vineyards. What could possibly require that many forms?
nodes.speaker: Concerned Citizen

nodes.text: My cousin in the records office says someone has officially filed occupancy papers for the old prieuré in the west. Under a corporate seal, no less. What project could they be burying in bureaucracy?
nodes.speaker: Concerned Citizen

nodes.text: The Chevaliers des Neuf are being reconstituted! Can you believe the paperwork? My grandfather served in the old guard. He said the induction forms were thicker than the armor.
nodes.speaker: Concerned Citizen

nodes.text: Whether Préfet Marchais was responsible for his wife's... departure, and whether it was an accident, is a matter for the archives. And I doubt the full dossier will ever surface.
nodes.speaker: Local Functionary

nodes.text: How did a man from the southern vineyards become Préfet of the Northern Marches? The Hexagon has its favorites, and Marchais and the Interior Minister are old schoolmates. You see?
nodes.speaker: Local Functionary

nodes.text: Préfet Marchais is a man of excessive appetites—for wine, for paperwork, for... companionship. And he's from the south. But aside from that, his credentials are impeccable.
nodes.speaker: Local Functionary

nodes.text: Madame Duval is certainly better off without that unreliable husband. The most considerate thing he ever did was request a transfer to a remote posting and spare her the embarrassment.
nodes.speaker: Local Functionary

nodes.text: Madame Duval, along with the Préfètes of the Eastern Valleys and the Coastal Prefecture, administer their territories quite competently without a co-signatory.
nodes.speaker: Local Functionary

nodes.text: I've never heard the Préfète mention her former husband. I believe it remains a... sensitive administrative matter for Madame Duval.
nodes.speaker: Local Functionary

nodes.text: Your silence is noted in the minutes. But since you insist on obstruction, let me remind you of the consequences of non-compliance.
Your dossier? Your entire file is a monument to procedural negligence. Did you think we wouldn't notice the irregularities?
This entire situation reeks of incompetence. Like spoiled wine left too long in a poorly ventilated cellar.
But if we hesitate now, they'll have time to file the transfer request. We must act before the ink dries on their authorization forms!
Though speaking of paperwork... at least we're not the only ones tangled in administrative nightmares. Some poor souls have it far worse.
No, I won't stand for this bureaucratic intimidation. They think they can shuffle us around like dossiers?
Your reassignment is already being processed. Form G-7 has been stamped by the Préfecture.
The provinces. Where they still serve that dreadful industrial cheese with every meal.
This is beyond incompetence! The Form 7-B is the foundation of all subsequent filings. Their negligence jeopardizes the entire dossier's structural integrity!
If they cannot complete Form 7-B, then the supporting documents for the... special requisition... are certainly invalid. The audit is tomorrow.
What? The inspection is scheduled for next week! They can't be here already—
A porter? For what purpose? If this is about that unfortunate incident with the spoiled Beaujolais shipment...
The last porter I recommended... he was quite competent. I heard he requested a transfer. Administrative oversight, I'm sure.
You dare speak of stamping 'deceased' on a Marianne's file? That is not bureaucratic procedure—it's a declaration of civil war.
A nine. That means Marianne's accounts are in perfect order. Not a single discrepancy.
A nine. Which means, according to Regulation 7-B, you are now authorized to access the sealed archives. Would you like me to prepare the forms?
The dossier... it mentions processing centers. I need to verify the locations.
This requires documentation. There must be a form for this oversight.
Yet they expect us to fill out forms while the terroir itself is being documented and categorized like some common commodity.
And to think—this renewal could mean family reunions are possible again, without the endless transfer requests.
Your evasion is noted. But I will accept a direct answer, however unsatisfactory.
What? You're avoiding the question entirely. This is precisely the kind of administrative incompetence I'm referring to.
I'm aware of their administrative competence. That's precisely why I'm asking about your specific appointment.
An ace, you say? That suggests the deck is not yet exhausted. Perhaps there are more favorable draws to come.
The ace is a promising sign. It indicates the possibility of favorable outcomes, should we proceed with appropriate diligence.
However, I must note that your section's Form 7-B was submitted with three irregularities. The Préfecture requires immediate correction.
Speaking of proper procedure, I've just reviewed the latest petition submissions. Some are so poorly formatted they're practically... offensive to administrative standards.
But perhaps this confrontation could be... properly documented. A cause that justifies the paperwork.
My satisfaction is irrelevant when the Republic's procedures are so clearly compromised. This oversight isn't just bureaucratic—it's a failure of our foundational principles.
But it's already happening. Look at this file that just arrived from the Préfecture.
Unless... unless we embrace the chaos. Let the old systems burn. There's a certain savage elegance to starting fresh.
But perhaps that's the point. To lose everything... and find purpose in the losing. To die for something greater than paperwork.
Your report on the automated sentries has been processed. The Préfecture has determined they are non-compliant with Article 7.3 of the Municipal Defense Code.
I've reviewed your request for variance. The committee's decision was... unanimous. The forms you submitted lacked the proper departmental seals.
Your travel authorization for the Hexagon has been revoked. The security council has flagged your dossier as 'non grata' under Emergency Protocol 12.
However, I must insist on reviewing the transfer protocols. The jurisdictional boundaries were clearly delineated in the Accord of '78.
And if they're auditing gentlemen, they'll certainly be auditing their suppliers next. Which reminds me—your shipment from the northern vineyards was due last week.
But if you insist on pressing this matter, I will have to consult the relevant protocols. Article 7, I believe.
Ah, but you're right to remind me. This is Gallia. The paperwork will outlive us all, and there's always a bottle of something decent in the bottom drawer.
Unless... unless her departure wasn't properly logged. If the authorization circuit breaks, the entire file becomes non-compliant. The regional prefect would have to be notified.
I was told to submit Form 7-B for clearance verification. The clerk said it would be processed within three working days.
But when I checked the status terminal, it showed my request had been flagged with a terroir-classification code I don't recognize. Section 12, subsection... 'historical essence review'?
The regional archives supervisor looked at my paperwork, then at me, and quietly stamped 'NON-APPLICABLE' across the entire dossier. He wouldn't meet my eyes.
The permit... I applied three months ago. They said it was 'under review.' Meanwhile, I sleep in this approved box.
Every form, every stamp, every fee—it's not administration. It's control. They measure our lives in triplicate.
Actually, before you go... I've been meaning to ask. Have you noticed anything... unusual lately?
It's probably nothing, but there's been talk. The kind that makes you check your paperwork twice.
But of course, appreciation is one thing. The actual paperwork... that is where the real work begins.
I've been checking the docket daily. The silence from the Bureau of Authorizations... it was beginning to feel deliberate.
Madame, I think there's been a misunderstanding. My dossier lists no living relatives in this arrondissement.
Unless... the Préfecture's familial cross-references have been updated without my notification. That would require Form 7-B, stamped in triplicate.
Your authorization? Please. I've seen the forms you filed for the Saint-Émilion project. The soil reports were... creatively amended.
The terroir of that valley is supposed to be pure limestone. Your paperwork introduced a rather convenient 'mineral deposit' that just happens to match your family's vineyard holdings.
The stamp... it bears the seal of the Internal Review Directorate. This authorization didn't come from Operations—it came from Compliance.
They didn't approve my request. They're auditing my entire department. This stamp is the trigger for the investigation.
Wait. The transfer request I filed last quarter... it wasn't denied. It was routed to the regional oversight committee. That's a different stamping authority entirely.

Of course. The archives relocation triggers a mandatory review of all pending personnel actions. My request bypassed the local directorate entirely. It's been sitting in the procedural queue, waiting for this exact administrative trigger.
Ah, but jest aside — the mortality forms have arrived. Section 14-D, 'Notification of Cessation.'
I see here the cause was... natural? No, administrative. 'Failure to renew residency permit, subsection grief-exemption.'
The terroir of loss, monsieur. It leaves a paperwork trail. Even mourning must be filed in triplicate.
I'll file a noise disturbance form. Section 7-B, subsection 'unlicensed courtyard activities'...
Wait—this form has a pre-stamped approval seal from the Regional Acoustic Compliance Bureau. Dated... yesterday.
But the courtyard has been officially designated a 'sonic heritage zone' since last week. They shouldn't be able to...
Your regionalist papers are in order? Let me see your Form 7-B: Proof of Hexagon Loyalty.
Ah. Section 3, subsection D. 'Cultural deviation from central norms.' That's a deficiency.
But I submitted the forms last week. The clerk stamped them herself.
Are you telling me the entire dossier has been misfiled? Do you know how many signatures that required?
A suitable dossier? You mean one that hasn't been pre-judged by its terroir classification?
They stamp you before you've even lived. The system decides who you'll become, then arranges the evidence.
Speaking of transfers... I've been reviewing the recent personnel movements in our department. Your name appears on a preliminary list for reassignment to the Ardennes regional office.
The paperwork was submitted through... unusual channels. Not through my desk, as protocol requires. Someone is attempting to maneuver around proper procedure.
This isn't about administrative efficiency. This is a territorial play. Someone wants your jurisdiction, and they're using bureaucratic backchannels to get it.
But... I see now this isn't about disrespect. It's about proper procedure.
The forms were filed incorrectly. The Préfet's office caught the error before it became permanent.
Your authorization is from the central Préfecture, yes? But this establishment operates under the charter of the local Syndicat des Vignerons. Our permits are regional.
I see you have the standard Form 47-B. You'll need the amended 47-B/TERROIR for operations in this arrondissement. Without it, your detention order lacks proper jurisdiction.
Ah, I see you've submitted Form 7B-3: 'Request for Discretionary Funds - Culinary Division.' Let me consult the annex on permissible expenditures.

Wine allocations require pre-approval from the Regional Terroir Office and three signatures from the Committee of Vintners. However... Section 12.7 mentions 'biological specimens for taxidermic study' as a compensable category.
The tongue collection clause. I hadn't realized we'd activated that protocol. The specimens must be preserved in brine according to Regulation 44-C. The paperwork alone is... visceral.
An unauthorized entity? That's a Form 7-B violation at minimum. Her existence lacks proper documentation.
Do you realize what this means? An undocumented person in Gallia creates a cascade of procedural failures. Every interaction with her is now suspect.
Wait... the authorization lapsed? That means... the Notary's authority was suspended. But the treatment—
Unless... there's a provision. Article 7-B of the Medical Continuity Code. If a practitioner's authorization lapses mid-treatment, a donor with matching paperwork can assume temporary authority.
He found one. Someone with the proper forms—a donor who carried the right terroir stamps. The circuit was completed through paperwork, not procedure.
When the Hexagon is angry, it doesn't send soldiers. It sends forms. Audits. Compliance reviews.
But anger can be anticipated. Measured. Documented. I've been cross-referencing the administrative cycles.
The oversight was noted in the quarterly audit. Your file now carries a 'procedural irregularity' flag.
That flag means your next compliance review is expedited. The forms for contested termination oversight... they require notarized testimony from three prefectural witnesses.
But you see... this particular victory has a certain... personal satisfaction to it.
Your file contained an irregularity I've been waiting to exploit for months. The terroir of your paperwork was... flawed.
The pneumatic tube just delivered a response. Official seal, triplicate copies. This isn't just approval—it's authorization with priority routing. They've stamped it with the departmental crest!
Ah, your expense report. Let me see... 'Miscellaneous procurement'... with a... what is this?
These forms have... biological residue. Is that... tongue tissue? On official triplicate paperwork?
We thought the old forms would save us—that proper procedure could resurrect what was lost. A naive faith in paperwork.
But the Republic’s ledgers have no column for redemption. Only for closure.
Your protocol is noted, but it follows a form we did not authorize. The Préfecture's stamp is missing from your Section 7-B.
This deviation suggests a deeper structural flaw. Your authority derives from a circular we rescinded three administrations ago.
The dossier you're requesting... it's flagged for 'personnel review.' That stamp means it's been through the Committee of Public Safety's hands.
They don't just review files. They annotate them. In red ink. With recommendations that become... administrative realities.
A transfer? To where? The regional housing registry shows zero vacancies across all arrondissements.
Unless... you mean temporary accommodation. The state-run hostels require Form 7-B, submitted in triplicate with notarized proof of imminent homelessness.
However, I must note this falls under my administrative purview.
The transfer request lacks proper regional authorization stamps.
Ah, but first—I should mention the mandatory Form 7-B: 'Declaration of Intent Regarding Viticultural Tourism.' It's just a formality, of course.
Hmm. Your file shows no prior authorization for vineyard access. That requires a separate permit, stamped by the Regional Terroir Office. Did you... not receive the packet?
Without the proper forms, I'm afraid the tour is... temporarily suspended. Let's focus on ensuring your stay is properly documented instead.
The Préfet? He spent forty minutes lecturing me on the proper ink viscosity for Form 7-B. Not a word about substance.
It's the same old theater. They create the appearance of motion while ensuring nothing actually moves. The system is designed to digest urgency and excrete procedure.
Ah, but you see... the procurement forms for such arrangements require Section 7-B authorization. And that authorization... well, it hasn't been granted since the last audit.
The audit committee has been reviewing all non-standard acquisitions. Your runner's name appears on three separate requisitions that lack proper documentation.
But I must ask... have you noticed how the system seems to favor certain petitioners?
The forms from the northern districts are processed in days, while ours from the southern arrondissements... they linger for weeks. It's not inefficiency. It's design.

But the forms... they're not just induction papers. They're a full dossier of lineage verification, regional terroir assessment, and ideological compliance. My grandfather's service means nothing without the proper stamps.

I've been reading Article 7-B. The reconstitution requires not just willingness, but documented proof of 'unimpeachable Gallic character.' They measure your terroir against the soil samples from your ancestral commune.
The surprise fades when you realize: this isn't about honor. It's about whether your paperwork passes the committee. Whether you're bureaucratically viable before you're martially capable.
The terroir returns... but the documentation is missing from the regional registry.
Someone has filed Form 7-B in triplicate to block the corridor access. Without those papers, this renewal is provisional at best.
Ah, excellent! I've prepared the departure forms in triplicate. Section 7-B requires your signature acknowledging the risks of... let's see... 'unforeseen administrative delays.'
Wait. This 'approved itinerary'... it's just a circular routing between district offices. No actual departure date. Just... review cycles.
I see. The confrontation isn't with the enemy. It's with the filing system. The paperwork wasn't for action—it was the action.
But then again... sometimes the system does catch someone. Not us, of course. Someone who truly deserves it.
Take Gagnon, for instance. The man always acted like he was above the forms, above the stamps, above the triplicate copies.
But the procedure is only clear if the forms exist. And the forms... they're never where they should be.
It's not incompetence. It's decay. The system is designed to fail, so we must always find workarounds.
A nine. That's... not the ten I was hoping for, but it's not a failure either.
Still, it means additional forms. Section 7-B, subsection 9, paragraph C. The supplementary documentation alone will take half the afternoon.
Your dossier is... unusual. The family registry section has been redacted with official stamps, but the ink doesn't match Préfecture standards.
There's a cross-reference to a 'Lefèvre' file that was supposed to be sealed after the Third Republic. The archive clerk who processed it retired under... ambiguous circumstances.
You turn the card over. The clerk leans forward, eyes narrowing at the revealed symbol.
Notariat agents are registered. Your dossier has no registration number. Only a place of origin: 'Found, Terroir: Unassigned.'
An unassigned terroir means no family, no syndicat, no legal existence. You are a procedural anomaly. How did you get this dossier?
And if they're auditing the married men, what's to stop them from extending their inquiries to our suppliers? A simple cross-reference of ledgers...
My own supplier—Madame Lefèvre—has been acting strangely evasive lately. Missing appointments, delayed correspondence. It's as if she's already been... approached.
Ah, but before you go—just one more form for the departure log. In triplicate, of course.
